author: Special Correspondent
text:
Zonal officers designated to Palayamkottai Assembly constituency to ensure smooth conduct of May 16 Assembly polls have been instructed to make sure availability of basic amenities at all 268 booths in the segment.

Chairing the meeting organised at the Corporation on Monday, Commissioner and Returning Officer of the constituency S. Sivasubramanian said that the designated Zonal Officers should ensure availability of toilets, drinking water and uninterrupted power supply at all the 268 booths in 95 polling stations in the segment as over 2.54 lakh voters would exercise their franchise. After personally inspecting the polling stations falling under their jurisdiction, the Zonal Officers should submit a report to the Returning Officer immediately so as to take steps to improve the prevailing situation.

“Moreover, the 22 Zonal Officers of Palayamkottai segment should enforce model code of conduct in their respective zones in a stringent manner which will ensure the conduct of elections in a free and fair manner,” Mr. Sivasubramanian said.

Assistant Returning Officer and Assistant Commissioner (Palayamkottai) N. Vasantharajan, Tahsildar (Palayamkottai) M. Natarajan, Deputy Tahsildar – Social Security Scheme, S. Raju, Deputy Tahsildar – Elections, S. Subramanian and zonal officers participated in the meeting.
title: Zonal officers to ensure basic amenities
